Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for Budget Travel”
Reviews.Author: Michele_Pope
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the YWCA was a pleasant surprise. The desk clerk graciously allowed us to check in early and we made our way up to our room with very little delay. Although I was slightly concerned about security, the key to activate the elevator along with the locks on the door and the locking system on the shared bathroom doors, made me feel much relieved. Our room had two twin beds and an excellent flat screen tv. The establishment loses a few points for an obviously broken desk and a leak in the ceiling over the closet. The ceiling tile was discolored which I thought meant the leak was old. However, the pillow on the shelf was also stained which told me the leak was more recent (or maybe the pillow hadn't been moved for a long time?). Wireless Internet was an extra CD$6 a day, which I didn't mind too much. A tip for those who have a room with a shared bathroom...bring rubber shower shoes. We were aghast to hear our neighbors blowing their nose IN THE SHOWER. Revolting. You'll love the location of this hotel. It's two blocks from the metro and 2.5 blocks from Cafe Medina. The area is safe, the hotel is secure and the staff incredibly friendly and helpful. I would not hesistate to stay here again but perhaps would select a room with a private bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Surprising, Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: Sue F
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the YWCA Hotel while I was in Vancouver at a conference. The conference was held on the water front at the Vancouver Convention Center. Many of my colleagues stayed in the hotels surrounding the Center. For less than half the price of those hotels, I thoroughly enjoyed the YWCA. It had everything we needed. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. The staff is warm, friendly knowledgable and helpful. The other guests were travelers from around the globe. All the visitors seemed to be margin conscious travelers with a good sense for a good deal. It was a treat to have a nice walk to and from the conference center each day. The best part of my stay came at the end. My car would not start, due to having left a light on for a number of days. The hotel engineer graciously came to my rescue. He helped me work out how to make all of my meetings and return to the hotel later in the afternoon while he was still working and gladly jumped my car and got me heading home. This sort of help and support was beyond the call of duty. The YWCA is full of good people already around making it a lovely choice for a stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “YWCA Hotel Is Vancouver's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: Bert H
Reviews.Content: I've been visiting the YWCA as a budget conscious traveller since September 2000. My 30 day stay in March and April 2012 was excellent. Staff are superb, rooms are clean and safe, and the location to Public Transit and event centres is "A1". This is a great place to stay in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: sommer14
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the YWCA last Dec 2011 for more than a week. we spent our first night in a room with one double bed - they don't have queen sized beds.the room itself was really good sized but one double bed was too small for us and our daughter. the next day, we left our luggage with them (they have a luggage room-will store for a minimal fee) and left for whistler for around 5 days. when we got back, we got the room with 2 double beds - this was just right for us. if you plan to do a bit of cooking, do request a room on a kitchen floor. they don't have kitchens on every floor. some floors have a kitchenette (a smaller, less equipped smaller kitchen)and others a full kitchen. we were on the floor with the most equipped kitchen - i think it was the 7th floor. it might get a bit noisy for those with rooms right near where the kitchen is tho, with people going in and out the kitchen..we got the room on the hall parallel to the kitchen hall so we couldn't say for sure how 'noisy' it can get -if it ever does at all. the kitchen we had have 3 stove tops and ovens, a refrigerator, electric kettle, bread toaster and a microwave . cabinets and drawers which you can claim as your space and lock -if you don't want anyone to mistakenly open it and use your stuff. 4 square tables and around 8 chairs. peolpe using the kitchen are very courteous to each other but not overly friendly where you will have to start talking even if you don't want to. a 'hi, how are you' and 'goodbye' is the standard.there will be times when you will have to share the kitchen with other guests. this will depend on how often you go to the kitchen and the season - we were there Christmas eve till new year - so we shared the kitchen with another group-which was not a problem at all. room decor is standard and decent.it was exactly like the pictures on the website. room is cleaned everyday. we were advised that rooms might not be cleaned on Christmas day, however, our room still got cleaned. there were a lot of pleasant surprises - kids get to choose a free toy upon checking in, chocolates from the staff for Christmas, free coffee and pastries from the ground floor cafe on Christmas day - we didn't try it, so can't say how it was. a vending machine and computers on the ground floor. wifi is not free but fee is only minimal.signal was not a problem, strong and not spotty. closest sky train station is around two blocks away (5min walk) - a straight walk to the left when you leave the hotel-i think it was the Chinatown station. to get to the shopping area, turn right when you leave, right on the corner and walk straight - on the whole stretch are shops, restaurants, groceries (there's an iga).don't miss to visit and spend some time in their public library - it's a good place to relax .non- bc residents can use it but not bring books out. ferdinand at the reception was such a great help to us. giving us useful tips around the place.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time”
Reviews.Author: Courtenayboy
Reviews.Content: This was the 3rd visit to this hotel for us. We took the room with 5 single beds and it's own bathroom. I guess they rent it to kids or sports teams because it smelled like a hockey bag in the room. Nevertheless, this hotel is a great location to stay at if you're attending a game at BC Place or a hockey game. It's a 5 minute walk to either place and the rooms are priced reasonably. We had no complaints with our rooms on other occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectually situated”
Reviews.Author: macca46
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. We have stayed in both the double rooms with hallway facilities and also the double rooms with shared facilities. We found the rooms with hallway facilities had more room to spread cases/clothes etc and had no trouble with having to wait to use shower/toilet facilities. Kitchen equipment is provided if needed. Perfectually situated to get to all transport, YaleTown, Gas Town, Up town, Downtown, all walkable. Big Red bus goes past the front door. The staff are really friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great palce to stay”
Reviews.Author: LadyWithLuggage
Reviews.Content: More of a basic hotel than the Y I was expecting. Great beds and comfy, snuggly duvets. Small rooms but with a bed, a fridge and a sink, (and optional TV) , what else do you need? Well, some bright spark came up with the idea of supplying a generous box with kitchen equipment containing pots, plates and cutlery- fabulous! Situated in a safe area with plenty of places to eat nearby, from steak to noodles, and with wonderful friendly and helpful staff. Also only $7 taxi to the Amtrak train station for early morning departures

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Faith Ann A
Reviews.Content: Only a couple blocks from the nearest SkyTrain station, the location of this hotel is a major plus. You have Robson street within walking distance, China Town and Gas Town are a within walking distance. Basically you can't go wrong with this location. The staff is amazing. The website speaks the truth when they claim to have friendly staff. Each person was pleasant to talk with regardless of the hour and willing to help with concerns. Rooms were small but very comfortable and clean. Didn't have any trouble with "neighbors" and the access to full kitchens, laundry rooms, and television lounges were a huge bonus! Down to earth environment, ultra friendly staff, superb location, absolutely brilliant place to rest your head while in Vancouver and "Worth Checking Into."

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: IroMac
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel. It is clean, staff is friendly. The rooms are really small and we had a beautiful view towards a building wall 2 meters across the street. Internet is for free and very fast. The location is not too bad, could be better.

Reviews.Title: “"Storers the explorers ''”
Reviews.Author: HalfpintJilly
Reviews.Content: The prices for hotels in Vancouver were just silly.They all appeared very over priced. When a work mate of ours who also does alot of travelling recommended we look up the YWCA Hotel we both laughed. We have never stayed in this type of accomadation before and had some nasty preconcieved ideas about what we could possibly expect for that price, To our amazement we both found it to be a wonderfull place , that caters to everyones budget and accomadation needs. For us it made Vancouver a very cost effective stay. We stayed there on 2 seperate occassions each for over a week. Each time we got a Bright ,sun filled private room with our own private ensuite bathroom. Rooms were moderate in size ,very clean and well serviced daily.The room had a moderate size fridge,iron and ironing board , tea and coffee making facilitys and a very comfortable queensize bed. The room decore was reasonable and well cared for. We were also given a plastic box to use for our stay that contained basic cooking utensils and cuttlery. Large shared well equiped kitchens were located on a few of the floors of the hotel for guests use ...if they wanted. Reception staff were very efficient ,welcoming and had wonderfull knowledge about all of the local attractions and locations to visit.. On the ground floor was a small coffee bar that served wonderfull hot choclate and coffee. The ground floor also had internet terminals for guests to use. The price was reasonable. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Wifi Cost Money.”
Reviews.Author: jedimaster10248
Reviews.Content: For a YWCA Hotel you can't expect much. The single rooms are small and some washrooms are shared. Also wifi cost money. But on the other hand you need a cheap place to stay, for a night, and good access to downtown Vancouver then this is the place for you. There's also a kitchen (that's shared by everybody in the building), and a small cafe (but no restaurant).

Reviews.Title: “Unusual but affordable hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Sandy_85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights as part of a ten day trip in Western Canada. We have never stayed in this sort of hotel before but the prices of vancouver accommodation can get extremely high compared to other north american destinations we've visited before! The thing that swung it for us was a promo they were doing with the tourist board where you got a free giftcard to spend on tickets/tours etc as part of the vancouver 125 celebration - check it out if it's still running! Room was small and neat with extremely garish fabrics but seemed really clean. Fridge in the room which was handy, we got a corner room to nice and bright. Strange shared bathroom arrangement where you share a toilet/shower room with the room next door and there is a funny security locking mechanism which takes a little getting used to! There are rooms with private facilities but they are much more expensive. Sink in the room. Staff were very helpful and assisted with the few questions we had, seemed to have quite an active function business from the comings and goings in the lobby, there were computers in the lobby for a fee but they were broken nearly all of the time we were there. i think there was wifi though for a fee if you wanted. location pretty handy, 7-8min walk from the downtown skytrain station straight down a main street, not hard at all, right opposite the big sports stadium on the south side of downtown. Unusual arrangement but they seem to be frequently available for 99cad/night which is good for vancouver - i'd stay again but i'm hoping next time i go back my budget wil be able to increase a little! Nice place if you don't mind the strange bathroom arrangements!

Reviews.Title: “groovers in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Flora510
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 nights on the 1st leg of our "big Canadian trip." It was very clean & comfortable. The staff were very helpfull. The location was spot on.We used the kitchen faciities, and " borrowed"delph from reception, for the duration of our stay. The only thing we missed was a padlock to keep our food in the kitchen, but as we were only one floor up it didnt present a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location!”
Reviews.Author: Rachael B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Y for eight days and we found the staff to be very friendly & helpful, and the room to be perfect for what we needed. The hotel is in a great location, close to Robson St for your shopping needs and two blocks to the train station. Our room was very clean and comfortable, not the largest but there are TV rooms with couch's & tables and comunal kitchens available for guests to use. The kitchen was very clean and there are plates, pots, pans and cultlery available for use from the front desk. Great stay and would come back again!

Reviews.Title: “There is no pool at the Y”
Reviews.Author: CMR6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after an Alaska Cruise/tour. The staff were very helpful, the room was clean and comfortable, and the price was very reasonable. There is no pool or exercise room, no fancy restaurant or free continental breakfast, but you can get coffee and a pastry in the little shop off the lobby. We took the hop-on hop-off bus tour, using stop #13 which is just around the corner. If you are looking for a reasonable place to stay while you explore Vancouver, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaytime40
Reviews.Content: We found this a great place to stay, staff were very helpful and our room was perfect. We had all the amenities with TV, alarm clock, fridge etc etc. Wifi connection available. 2 blocks to train and close walk to Robson Street for restaurants and shopping. Walking distance to False Creek to catch Ferry to Granville Island. Our room was clean and very comfortable and very quiet. There are kitchen facilities on every few floors and a coffee shop on the ground floor. We chose a room with a shared bathroom down the hall that was always clean. Definitely value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: mgv99
Reviews.Content: If your budget is tight, this is a good option, especially if you're a Y member (added discount). It's certainly a no-frills accommodation, but it's downtown AND parking is only ~$10/night and in an enclosed garage. It's near the not-so-great part of town, but...don't walk around Chinatown/Gastown at night and you're fine. Internet on site. We did have to call someone to fix the toilet, and they asked if we could wait a couple hours to have it fixed- we were on our way out so it wasn't an issue but don't know what they'd have said if it was.

Reviews.Title: “The staff were all very helpful. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: basenjigirl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good value for the city. The location is near the Canada line so convenient for getting to and from the airport as well as other locations. The staff were knowledgeable and helpful about area information. We found the rooms to be a bit noisy and warm without much control over the temperature. Overall, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay for above average price”
Reviews.Author: sh1979
Reviews.Content: My friend booked the Vacouver YWCA for our overight trip; I was surprised at the $150 per night rate, but she said it is nice. While the location is good and the staff friendly and helpful, it is a very ordinary, institutional-feeling facility. It is clean, but dated. I can't imagine that there aren't nicer places to stay for a similar price, although coming from Seattle I do find the prices in Vancouver high, and the current USD value doesn't help.

Reviews.Title: “Defiantly worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Megan000
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights here in a single room. It's very basic place but very good prices. If ur like me don't need any thing fancy just a place to rest your head at night then this would be it. The staff were very friendly and helpful. I had a few hassles with my luggage as it didn't fly over with me and they helped sort it out. Good location about 5 minute walk to the main shopping mall would have to get transport any where else probably alittle far, although I did walk.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, central location, safe area”
Reviews.Author: Kelloggs2104
Reviews.Content: Stayed here end of July for 3 nights on 9th floor front room facing BC Stadium. Double bed with shared bathroom - no problems. Room had washbasin and fridge. Reception staff very helpful. Room clean, bed comfortable. Hallways & carpets clean/tidy. Coffee shop ground floor. Kitchen floor above & laundry facilities. Good location, one block away from Stadium/Chinatown Skytrain station. Georgian Court Hotel with good restaurant next door - tour buses stop there. Other restaurants nearby on Robson Street and West Georgia Street. Vancouver Library nearby for free internet use (2 hours per day) with printers. Good cafe at Vancouver Art Gallery in Robson Square nearby. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good price and location location LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: cijay
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed here for a few nights while visiting various relatives and friends. It's quiet, clean, the staff is very friendly and the location is safe. We don't drive or know much about the city but this location has many buses and the sky train at your fingertips. Plenty of places to go to eat or a cup of tea, shopping and is just a generally good "springboard" to go in any direction.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be afraid, this is a great place!”
Reviews.Author: blinknoodle
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here. I was a bit hesitant because I wasn't sure whether it would be dorm-room style. It wasn't. I was in a triple room with a shared bathroom on a floor with a kitchen - I couldn't have asked for more. The price was right, the room was clean and quiet, the beds were comfortable and we were probably the only ones using the hall washrooms. i think every room also has a mini fridge, but the kitchen was great if you wanted to cook something. The mini fridge helped by keeping my food closeby. There are tons of places nearby to buy food, the best is probably T&T, an Asian grocery store with a lot of prepared food and fresh produce. I highly recommend the YWCA hotel and would be back in a heart beat. The value cannot be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, very good value”
Reviews.Author: Kiwitraveller1943
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in the YWCA for three nights and had a thoroughly positive experience. The staff were very helpful, the physical appointment of the bulding is small but quite adequate, and the room small-ish but not a problem and very well prepared and everything worked well. The location meant we did a fair bit of walking into the city but we could have used the subway which was quite close if we had wanted to. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great central location at budget price”
Reviews.Author: laieu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days. Really great location, close to Downtown, Gastown, Chinatown ... public transport in walking distance, quite a few decent restaurants close by, coffee shop adjacent to reception area. Very friendly and helpful staff, clean rooms and showers (which for us were shared in the hallway, but per our deliberate choice, as we don't mind; they also have en-suite rooms available for those who prefer their privacy). Kitchen is available for guest use (not on every floor; we were on the 7th that has a kitchen). Fridge in the room and sink, too . Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fair accommodation in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: zenzen1984
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here one night in June, 2011. We arrived very late after a flight from Anchorage, so it was convenient to stay in a hostel with a 24 hour reception. The room was simple, but adequate. The shared bathroom was fine, with an average shower. The wifi wasn't free, which was a shame compared with other hostels/hotels we had been to. The price was reasonable, and the loction convenient. Plenty of baggage storage which is always handy. No real complaints, fair quality and price.

Reviews.Title: “Central location with good value”
Reviews.Author: MakkiPakki
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Hotel has rather small rooms with basic standard, but they are very clean and include everything you need. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and really do the best to assist you in any way. The hotel has a very central location with many great bars and restaurants within walking distance. It is also very close to the Rogers ice hockey arena, if you are a sports fan! The harbour conference centre and the beautiful Stanley Park is a bit far away, but the close proximity to the underground makes it quite easy to travel there. The same goes for the large YWCA fitness centre, which guests can use for free. I think the YWCA Hotel gives great value for money and I can definitely recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: AussieKathy
Reviews.Content: We just spent 5 nights at YWCA. Very quiet in a good central location. Basic room but met all our needs. Close to skytrain station $5 taxi fare to downtown. WiFi $22 for the week. Staff friendly and helpful. Can't beat it for a budget hotel. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Should have better value for the money..”
Reviews.Author: Karzack
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Georgian Court just next door from YWCA 3 years ago and thought that I tried to stay here after reading the favorable reviews. Originaly we planned to stay for 4 nights but after we experienced the small room and a very regular bed and the fact that Wi-Fi was not free, we decided to stay only 1 night. The good thing about YWCA is that they don't fuss about this and credited my cards without a problem. I think YWCA is ok but I rather pay $ 25 pernight at Georgian Court next door which have much larger room, plusher beds and as also provide free Wi-Fi and complimentary bicycle rental which was a great value for the 4 of us as you would have to pay $ 25 rental per person for half a day rental...YWCA should increase its value proposition or lower the price to achieve the value for money I am looking for...

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: jules7706
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for first couple of nights in Vancouver and it was a good deal compared to other accommodation around. Room was small - overall it was clean though the carpet looked a bit worn in parts and probably needs to be replaced soon. I stayed in a double room with shared bathroom facilities - which worked out fine. Reception was efficient but not overly friendly. I did have a problem with someone calling my room asking to measure the television and explained that to reception as it seemed a bit strange. It might have been the maintenance man according to them but still it doesn't seem correct for anyone but reception to be calling your room. I didn't use internet or kitchen facilities so can't really comment on them. Liked the hotel next door which has an Italian restaurant - had dinner there one night and availed of their free internet. Was some noise in the corridor the first night at the YWCA but nothing too prolonged. Would probably stay here again if travelling on a budget - if I had some money to spare though I'd stay elsewhere. But much better option than a hostel, especially if you're travelling alone and want some privacy.

Reviews.Title: “good choice for solo traveller; BUT neighbourhood can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: Doeraymee
Reviews.Content: Good budget choice. Clean rooms, good security/service at desk, as others have noted. I liked the fact that the shared bathrooms were just like bathrooms at home (toilet, sink, shower all in one), unlike some places that have stalls and never seem very comfortable/safe. Free local phone calls from your room ....very helpful! Rooms cleaned every day. However, if you are looking for a quiet stay, avoid staying here during hockey games (and possibly some concerts). I stayed here in June during the Stanley Cup hockey finals 2011. Luckily I left the morning of the riot after Game 7 when cars were set on fire, stores broken into, etc) but I was here for Game 5 and Game 6. Game 6 wasn't bad but there were yahoos running through the streets and screaming after Game 5... for several hours. And the sidewalks reeked of stale beer and urine the next morning. I was a bit surprised a couple of things, but they were easily fixed: 1. Tiny cafe in front serving just bagels/cookies. No real breakfast, eggs etc. But I found a good breakfast place around the corner, attached to the Library. It's called Gutenberg. (Just remember the first printing press...) 2. Internet ... they charged $1 per 7.5 minutes. Yes. 7 min and 30 seconds. Not sure what happens if you go 1 second over!! Is that another $1. But you can go to the Library for free and use the internet there. A few blocks away. No big deal. 3. Renting pots/cutlery, plates etc. They charge $2.50 per day (EVERY day you use them so this can add up if you're there for a week or so). This seems a bit tacky, as most hostels I've stayed in come equipped with this and don't charge extra. If they're afraid of theft maybe they could just ask for a deposit and give it back to you when you check out. I did my research and for a solo traveller this was about the best deal I could find in Vancouver, which is expensive. However, if I was travelling with someone else I would probably search for a regular hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: mtemu
Reviews.Content: It was in a good location near to public transport but easy to walk downtown. The room was small but very clean comfortable bed and had excellent cooking facilities. All in all a good value for money budget choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget option.”
Reviews.Author: trabug
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as we needed a cheap option. Rooms are nothing fancy, but we weren't searching for nice. Safe, cheap, clean, helful staff, good location. Gym access was a plus. Only downpoint was we brought an expensive bike and we were not allowed to keep it in the room, which was not mentioned until we checked in (we had searched on the website for any such clauses and had found none). The downstairs section they wanted us to keep it in did not look safe, and we were not comfy leaving it there. Apart from this, good budget option, we would stay here again if in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Simple & Positioned”
Reviews.Author: Sparky2509
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in April. On arrival we receives a free upgrade to a private rom with ensuite because of availability, a great start! The rooms are small but have everything you need, Good cable, clean rooms, helpful staff. I was worried about staying in a 'y', never had before but my concerns were invalid. It's just like a hostel......the location for this one was the best thing, so close to everything in Vancouver, unfortunately the Cannucks weren't playing on the nights we were there, we could have wealked 3 blocks to the arena! just across the road from Vancouvers other arena....All in all a great place to stay, well recommended...

Reviews.Title: “Good, Basic Hotel & Good Value”
Reviews.Author: dianam41
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Hotel is a good, clean, basic hotel. It is right across the street from BC Place, next to the Georgian Court Hotel (an upscale property), and near Library Place, which has shopping, fast food restaurants (McD, Tim Horton's, A & W, DQ, Starbucks, Subway), a supermarket (IGA), and a 7-11. The Big Bus, a "hop on, hop off" tour bus, stops right next door at the Georgian Court. The bus will allow you to get almost anywhere in the greater downtown area (if you don't mind taking the scenic route). The hotel is also close to a Skytrain (Vancouver subway) stop, and is a about a 20 minute walk from Robson shopping district (along Robson the entire way). There is good security (keyed elevator, doors locked at 11 PM), so one feels very safe. Some of the rooms have 5 twin beds (!), which can accommodate a large family. The only caution is that not all rooms have a private bathroom. So, if you want a bathroom to yourself, make sure the room you have reserved has one (we did). You have to pay for internet access, although you can access the Georgian Court's free wi-fi in many parts of the hotel. It is not fancy by any means, but if you don't mind "no-frills," this is a great choice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit - Still great!”
Reviews.Author: ShavonnayAberdeen
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in October 2008 with my friend on a multi stop tour - Vancouver, Seattle and NYC. Back again this year for a few nights before heading up to Whistler... the hotel is still great! Nothing has changed at all - it's a great base for anyone wanting to explore the city and it's surroundings.... Staff friendly and helpful, rooms basic, but very clean and felt safe at all times.... The coffee shop in the lobby just as much appreciated for a morning coffee to take up whilst getting ready... and the chocolate banana muffins were brill! I really think this hotel suits all - single travellers, friends, couples, young and old... at a budget too!! Highly recommended!! I had hoped to return to Vancouver.... didn't think it would happen for a few years, however low and behold ended up in the lobby of the YWCA 2 years later,,,,, I just hope i'll return again... love Vancouver and love the YWCA! Thanks again for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Coutito
Reviews.Content: The location is central, close to the marina, restaurants, bars, and shops. Both the room and the bathroom were very clean and comfortable. Breakfast is not included but there is a small "restaurant" near the lobby. It's a quiet hotel, has lots of tourist information and the staff is friendly and can help with anything you ask. I highly recommend this place to travellers who look for an inexpensive and very decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: kluk01
Reviews.Content: After getting off the plan, we took the Canada line train from airport to downtown Vancouver and I found it really really convenience. Front desk staff was friendly and luckily we got upgrade to a twin-room with semi-shared private bath due to overbooking. The room is great with the view facing the street and harbour. We stayed there for 3 days and then joined 3-day tour to Victoria Islands Too bad, we were only assigned to a twin room with communal bath this time even we don't mind paying more for having a private bath hotel room as nothing left. We loved the kitchen in there, with tea pot, stove, microwave, fridge and oven and dinning area. Cutlery and cups and dishes have to pay for use. After eating breakfast, we packed our lunch in the kitchen before heading out to visit places. We bought bread, butter, instant noodles and TV dinners from A& P and T&N and stored in the fridge, it would not take long for us to have dinner when we coming back so tired every night and we just heated it up by microwave over there. Clean, tidy and functional kitchen in YWCA is the most highly recommendable budget hotel everyone can enjoy ! You can walk to the Public Library and buy grocery near the skytrain station, that is called T&T s Asian supermarket. We love it and having all kind of hot and packed food. If you are having backpack is fine but large baggage will be an issue if you have to walk to sky train station to take the Canada Line back to airport to catch the flight. It is because you have to walk about 15 to 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “My Go-to Hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: nycbee
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Y, having spent a week there in Feb. 2010, during the Olympics. Once again, I was not disappointed. The friendliness of staff, cleanliness of rooms, great downtown location, and bargain prices make this hotel a sure bet. It continues to be my first choice for a stay in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best”
Reviews.Author: Sabine81
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the BC Stadium, on the corner of Beatty and Robson street. Public transportation is close, the area is quiet at night and the staff was very friendly. We were four girls, had a big room with five comfy single beds and a nice bathroom. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “No frill, clean, and AFFORDABLE!”
Reviews.Author: I_love_the_rain
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a private room which was like a splurge since there are a lot of dorm rooms and shared bathrooms. It was totally clean and had what I needed, though not the most up-to-date decor or anything. That's okay. Staff was friendly (a little slow at the desk) and the location is unbeatable. A great and affordable place to stay in downtown Vancouver! I will certainly stay here again. It is too bad that parking and internet cost extra (but hey, it's the city).

Reviews.Title: “My new regular pick for Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: skiplightly
Reviews.Content: What a great deal. Not for luxury or perks. Who cares, though? Man, with the cost of hotels, this clean, friendly place in the heart of downtown is NUMBER 1.

Reviews.Title: “Love the YWCA”
Reviews.Author: chrispie
Reviews.Content: I love this place, its so clean! wish they had free wifi though, throughally impressed with the cleanliness and nice to have the cooking facilities especially with costco across the street. Excellent location!!!! parking $12 extra. Disspaointed they raised thier rates though. Stayed at the comfort inn on granville and this one is soooo much better. BOoked a room with five beds!!! which was much bigger and much nicer then the two dinky beds comfort inn had. Definately would stay here again. If your a YMCA member anywhere else you also get a discount

Reviews.Title: “Everything I didn't expect”
Reviews.Author: lumiere14
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip solo where I didn't have family waiting for me on the other side. I can't say I had too many expectations, but I am very satisfied with my experience. The room had all the commodities (actually more) than I would deem necessary. I'm a student, thus on a budget, so I was only really looking for a simple room to sleep in. I was greeted with a clean room, roomy spaces, air conditioner, wifi, mini fridge, and a folder with information such as phone numbers of my surroundings. The staff was friendly and the overall price was good (student discount). My overall priority was safety, and I was very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in a good location- but don't share a bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: smicer07
Reviews.Content: We recently came back to the UK from Vancouver having travelled also to Kamloops and over to the Rockies. We arrived at the YWCA Vancouver on the final leg of our journey. Positives: Easy, quick check in. Nice staff. Nice little coffee shop and vending machines in the front lobby. Reasonable rooms given the price. Good selection of TV channels if that's important to you. Bed fairly comfortable and no complaints with the maid. Good security. Negatives: We shared a bathroom- not a great idea when the people sharing it with us get up every morning at 5am, have a noisy shower and make a mess. Room is small. No tea/coffee facilities in room. Location, although good, is very close to the dodgy areas around Chinatown so be careful not to go the wrong way when leaving the hotel! NO free Internet- very disappointing. All in all, if you're looking for a cheap place to stay in Vancouver then go for this- but only if you don't mind sharing a bathroom. It really is luck of the draw if you go for the shared one because of the noise/mess/inconvenience and I wouldn't do it again- much better to spend a bit more and have your own room. The Ramada in Vancouver I found to be much nicer and in an even better location.

Reviews.Title: “Safe,Clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: CDNehAbbotsford
Reviews.Content: Great value for the location. Within walking distance of Rogers Arena (formerly GM Place), BC Place) Good restaurants, bars and shopping. Very clean and secure rooms with small fridge, iron and ironing board, and hairdryer. Could have used air conditioning. Friendly and efficient staff and cute little coffee bar on premises.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant suprise”
Reviews.Author: bearaware
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel for budget travelers, but I wanted a fridge in the room and a good location. It is tight in terms of space, but very clean. We had a double room on the 12th floor with a kitchenette on the floor the first time and asked for a floor with a kitchenette the second time on the 2nd floor. The hotel staff were friendly, there is a safety deposit box system and the security at night is good. There are full kitchens on various floors if you want to cook. I costs $2.50/day to hire a box with cutlery, crockery, plus pans. I needed a bigger pot and got it without extra charge. I had to change sides as there is only one bed side lamp. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Option”
Reviews.Author: TravelAddict1001
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay. The hotel is located just a few blocks from the Metro. You can take the train from the airport to the hotel. There is also a very reasonable airport shuttle ($12/person, $19/couple) that leaves the YWCA 3 times per day. We stayed in a room with a semi-private bath. We never had a problem using the bathroom at any time. It is very nice because there is still a sink in the room. If you stay here, don't forget to bring shampoo. There is also a small TV and a fridge in the room. That was very convenient as we tired of eating out every day. The rooms are very clean. The beds are a little firm, but the room is comfortable and we could regulate the temperature in the room. There is a full-sized kitchen on several floors for cooking. There are also laundry facilities with reasonable prices. While we didn't use the parking garage, there was parking that cost less than other nearby lots. While not close to the hotel, adults staying here can use the YMCA across town for swimming and working out. For people on a budget who want to spend money on activities rather than rooms, this is a great budget option, with rooms almost half the price (after taxes) of other nearby hotels. The location is very convenient. The staff were very friendly and helpful for giving directions and ideas for places to go. There is internet available for a fee (both on lobby computers and through wi-fi). However, if you want to access free internet, you can get a free temporary internet access card at the Vancouver Public Library just 2 blocks away. They have computers available, or you can use their wi-fi. Plus, they have a beautiful entrance that is a worth a visit in and of itself. In addition to saving money staying here, I felt good knowing that our hotel stay would help benefit the Y's social services efforts in the area. Overall, we were pleased with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a traveller on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: justfiddling
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the YWCA and was impressed with the convenient location just two blocks from Skytrain, reasonable rates, courteous service at the front desk, clean room with a fridge, sink and central air conditioning. I had wondered about the shared toilet and bath down the hall, but that turned out not to be a problem: everything was clean and, best yet, no line-ups! I will definitely return. Thank you YWCA!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: salbot
Reviews.Content: Found this hostel to be very good. It was more like a hotel really. The rooms were clean and big enough for us, we had a sink and TV in the room and a place to hang our clothes. The shared bathrooms were always kept clean and there were always ones available to use. The staff were really friendly also. The hostel was in a great location too. The only downsides were that it didn't include breakfast and you had to pay $2.50 a day to use pots, pans and plates etc. They said this was due to things going missing but surely a deposit would suffice and encourage people to return things. There also wan't free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Clean facility, uncomfortable bedding and shower.”
Reviews.Author: taipa
Reviews.Content: Nice facility with great staff / clean cozy rooms. Unfortunately, I was very unimpressed with the shower and bedding. The shower couldn't get the shampoo out of my hair. The bedding / blankets were too thin for Vancouver weather.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: cyrillota
Reviews.Content: reasonable value for money - clean, small rooms with almost all great staff except one. wish internet access in rooms is included in the payment though - still need to pay for it separately.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: TheTourist2010
Reviews.Content: Front desk get’s top marks for being helpful and courteous. They helped us plan our trips around the city and provided maps and a sheet with some of the more popular landmarks and how to get there. A young girl with a Japanese accent at the front desk was especially helpful with suggestions. This is a no frills hotel. Besides a TV in the room there are no other amenities: no refrigerator, no microwave, no internet, no breakfast. The cheap rate is offset by a charge for most services Internet-wifi is available but for a fee. The fee is $6 per 24 hour period. Weekly and monthly rates are a bit cheaper Ice is available for 25 cents. A bucket will cost you 50 cents Breakfast rolls and drinks can be purchased from the small coffee shop on the ground floor. Each room has only one key. You deposit the key at the front desk when you leave so other people sharing your room can pick up the key when they come in. This works pretty well….except when the keeper of the keys in the bathroom when you are trying to get into your room If you want to save some money and prepare your own meals, there is a kitchen on the 10th floor with microwave , common refrigerator , electric stove, toaster and coffee maker as well as a sink for washing dishes. Bring your own utensils and dishes. There is seating for about 10 people. There is also a lounge on the 10th floor with a table and 4 chairs, several couches and a TV set. There is a microwave on each floor in the small kitchen area Getting to and from the hotel from the airport is easy by public transportation. Vancouver is served by a skytrain that runs from the airport to the waterfront station. From there you can pick up the skytrain to the China town station which is just a block or so from the hotel. The skytrain allows luggage on board…although there may be a few stairs to climb with your bags if no elevator is available. Skytrain station ticket machines take cash, ATM or credit cards. Buses only take Canadian coins (no bills) and you must have exact change.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and excellent rooms”
Reviews.Author: jhorsfield30
Reviews.Content: This is a simply star of a hotel, run by the tourism department of the YWCA, this quality hotel, has excellent rooms and has always maintained a high level of standard in the 4 years I've been coming here. Very friendly staff, the prices are less than average for a high quality option. Book in advance for the best deals, and I believe there was a student discount at one point. Also, if you stay here, you could use the YWCA Fitness centre, in downtown vancouver. Which is a great fitness facility with a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Very few negative things to say”
Reviews.Author: Mmmarrie
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 days when I arrived in Vancouver, before finding an apartement. It was very safe so I could leave all my stuff in my room while visiting accomodations all day long. The hotel is well situated as you can walk in Downtown Vancouver and there are two Skytrain stations close by : the Stadium-Chinatown station on Expo and Millenium lines, and the Yaletown station on Canada line (the one that links Downtown Vancouver to the airport). I had already been in a hotel with a shared bathroom, so it didn't bother me. There were two bathrooms on my floor, one with shower only and the other one with shower, washbasin and toilets. I never found any of these unavailable in 3 days. However, I couldn't figure out how to get hot water in the showers (but then it's my fault if I didn't ask). Rooms are clean and there was a washbasin in mine. The staff is very nice and helpful. You can ask them anything about visiting Vancouver or living in Canada, they'll answer eagerly even if it has nothing to do with your stay at the hotel itself. There's a locked storage room if you need to leave heavy things for a few hours after check out. Finally, I thought wireless internet was included in the price of the room, but actually it's 6 CAD a day (24 hours from the time you buy it).

Reviews.Title: “Best Value for $$$”
Reviews.Author: deezerness
Reviews.Content: The place is clean. The bathrooms, toilets and kitchens are very clean and cleaned on a daily basis. The staff were always warm and welcoming and have alot of information on hand. Coffee is always available although there are not much breakfast choices from the cafe. The location starts on the main drag, Robson St. It was a clean and safe area and also close to the GM Place. This is THE ONLY place to stay if you are on a budget but want a clean room and safe location.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: adelayed78
Reviews.Content: The YWCA Hotel in Vancouver was our first stop after flying in from Australia. We hadn't slept for over a day, but managed to easily get to the hotel from the airport on the new Canada Line and the reliable SkyTrain - which has a stop a short walk from the hotel. We were on a budget, and happily used the Internet facilities at the public library a few blocks north on Robson. The IGA Supermarket also helped us keep the finances under control. (But, there are so many good eating experiences nearby - Nuba on Hastings is a MUST!) We had a few nights out, and we were happy with the after-hours hotel security. The hotel is not in a bad location, but Vancouver does have a big homeless population. We were let back in the hotel quickly by the helpful staff. Quiet and clean rooms, central location, and cheap! If I ever end up in Vancouver again, I know where I'll go.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: claireread
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel september 09.I was pleasently surprised,very clean, no noise,great hot showers.Security was excelent.About 4 blocks walk from the train station.I felt very safe and there is a coffee shop at the front door,priced around $90 australian it was great value.I would stay there again, no worries

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: nycbee
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel and would not stay anywhere else when next in Vancouver. I was in the city last month for the Olympics and my 8 nights at the Y were heavenly. My room had a double bed with private bath. The room may have been on the smallish side, but the way it was laid out made it feel larger than it was. The Y just did not have a hotel feel to it--I felt like I was at home. The hotel is superbly run--it's squeaky clean and the staff could not be better or more welcoming. Barb, the manager, is simple amazing and the rest of the staff, from the front desk to the housekeepers, is also fantastic and caring. The coffee bar right off the lobby was most convenient and the location of the hotel (directly across the street from BC Place) could not be better. On my last day there, I was worried about my flight home getting cancelled due to a snowstorm in New York City, so I booked a single room with hall bath for one night. I have to say, though I much prefer a private bath, this room was quite nice. It was their smallest type of room, but again, there was something about the layout, that made it seem larger than it actually was. I could go on forever about how great the Y is, but ehe bottom line here is that Vancouver is a wonderful city so why not complement the city by staying in a wonderful hotel (at a price that can't be beat!)

Reviews.Title: “YWCA Hotel - Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Scooter2s
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel atleast once a year for conferences and have also stayed here for concerts, theatre and other performances, plus vacations. It's conveniently located in downtown across from BC Place, within walking distance of GM Place, Vancouver Public Library and Queen Elizabeth Theatre. There are restaurants and small grocery stores nearby. The only drawback, is it's a bit noisy & busy on the streets after a concert or game, but it subsides usually by 11pm or so and isn't an everyday occurance. This is to be expected for a large city. Private rooms for solo travellers or rooms for sports teams, family, groups, very affordable, clean and safe.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jorgemendoza
Reviews.Content: its a cleaned, very well located hotel near main Robson Street and commercial district. I really enjoyed my staying there and the staff was very kind.

Reviews.Title: “worth checking in”
Reviews.Author: punaipeyar
Reviews.Content: i stayed at ywca@beatty street in dec while attending a conf. you get the following: friendly staff, clean & warm rooms, good housekeeping and great ambiance. count on the front desk staff for any assistance and help. in fact if you wish you could stop reading at this point and get the rest from the front desk! the hotel has an almost ideal location. robson st and georgia st are full of shops and cafes. important ones are london drugs, sears, (pacific and bay are lil more costly) a good indian restaurant india gate@robson. add to this vancouver art gallery and vancouver public library virtually next door to ywca. and and of course this is just 5 mins walk from vancouver central skyline station. even stanley park is just a walk away for the health conscious! this is true of any other hotel in robson and georgia, but ywca is friendly to yr pocket. cost is cheap but not the quality! highly recommended for ppl on a budget, esp students.

Reviews.Title: “worst service and unclean”
Reviews.Author: arlene01
Reviews.Content: worst service, treatment by staff and filthy rooms. After 17 years of staying there, the last two visits .to this location. have been horrible! Wont give a thrid chance ever. For a few extras dollars go around the corner to the Sandman.

Reviews.Title: “clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: wordupmybrotha
Reviews.Content: This hostel is an economical option which is clean safe and comfortable. They had great service. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great value budget accommodation in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: HLF
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights at the start of my holiday. I had a single room with a shared bathroom, which means there is one shower and toilet shared between two rooms. My room was clean and basic, but had plenty of space, a wash basin and a fridge. The shared bathroom concept is a little strange as it can feel like there's a stranger in your en-suite (which, in fact, there is!). However, the locking system means that no-one can enter the other room by accident. The hotel's location is fantastic and, for the price, it is excellent value for money. There's also a small coffee bar in reception which is perfect for a quick and cheap breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Secure Parking... Clean & Safe.”
Reviews.Author: zcheeze
Reviews.Content: This hotel accommodates many different kinds of travelers... it can be a hostel-style, or complete privacy is available. The prices are affordable, and I loved the underground parking where we were able to leave our vehicle the entire stay. CLEAN & SAFE! Nice, helpful staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very good budget accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Trippy_times
Reviews.Content: The YWCA is a very good hostel located in downtown Vancouver. It is right at the edge of the downtown area and is easily acsessed by public transport. Get the sky train to the stadium/chinatown stop and its a short walk from there. Getting there by car could be hard with Vancouver's busy city centre roads. The staff were very helpful and freindly providing us with all the info we needed on what to do and how to get there in Vancouver. The room was good with a queen sized bed, a small fridge and a tv. The bathroom and toilet are shared by the whole floor, but this was never an issue because the hostel is so big I think we almost had the floor to ourselves. There was a kitchen and dining area on our floor as well. Downstairs in the lobby there is internet available that accept coins. There is also a very small cafe serving snacks and drinks. The whole of the hostel is very clean and the rooms are serviced every day. To be able to stay in Vancouver at a good rate is hard to do but this place ticked all the boxes. It was extremely good value and we had a lovely time staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location, Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ShavonnayAberdeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the YWCA with my friend for 7 nights in total. Check in was friendly and helpful, esecially appreciated after almost 24 hours travelling! Rooms were basic, but very clean and welcoming.. The hotel was in a great location for us- just across from BC Place and GM Place, next to some good bars and restraunts and just minutes walk from the centre of town. Beng 2 young females, we always felt safe, which was a big concern for us being so far from home! The little coffee shop within the hotel was also greatly appreciated first thing in the morning and was again, friendly and welcoming. All in all, i'd highly recommend this hotel to any traveller for it's laid back, friendly service and it's great value for money!

Reviews.Title: “The worst night staff in all of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: VancouverLife
Reviews.Content: When returning to the hotel in the evening, as soon as my friends and I walked into the lobby the front desk lady rudely yelled out at us asking if we were checking in. She then also bluntly asked what room we were staying in and then proceeded to ask us if we were all staying in the room together. It was just my friend and I staying in the hotel room and the other friend who was with us was just grabbing some items from us that were in the room. The front desk clerk very rudley asked us if my friend was also staying with us. When my friend replied that she was not staying in the hotel room the front desk clerk asked how long she was planning on staying up in the room for and that if it was for very long then she was going to charge her for it. My friend told the front desk clerk very calmy that she did not intend on staying for very long. The front desk lady then yelled out very impoilitely to "give me your i.d". There were no manners used, no courteousy. It was the most awful customer service I had ever seen. My friend then gave the lady her driver's liscence and as we were waiting for the elevator to reach the lobby, my friend made us laugh (may I point out that it was not loud whatsoever) and the front desk clerk once again barked at us that they have a NO NOISE policy. My friend and I turned towards the front desk clerk and told her that we had no intention on causing any problems at all, we just wanted to go to our room for the night. Her last comment to us was that she could "call the cops on us!" The hotel still has my friend's i.d, they never gave it back to her. This was by far the most disgusting service I have ever experienced at a hotel. I would never expect anyone to speak to me the way that the front desk clerk did that night, especially not someone who works in a customer service industry. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone. I would highly discourage people from using the YWCA of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “It's fun to stay at the Y-W-C-A”
Reviews.Author: teamgraffey
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night before our road trip to the Rockies. This place was excellent value, clean and with friendly and helpful staff. For the price, the rooms were fine, with lots of space. The bathroom on our floor was nice and clean and never busy. This place is in a good location and close to everything. For the one fantastic summer day we had in Vancouver we walked from the hotel through the city and down to Stanley Park, exploring everyhting on offer. This day was one of the highlights of our trip. The hotel reception staff are very helpful and there's lots of information available. There's two computers as well with internet access (you have to pay) although they can get a little busy. In the hotel is a small coffee shop and next door is a pub where you can get a drink and where we had a nice lunch. And also, Vancouver is a fantastic city so get out there and see it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, bargain price”
Reviews.Author: twinkly
Reviews.Content: This place was perfect for us. Yes, not luxurious by any means, but for the price and the location I don't think anyone could argue with it. We had a room with a shared bathroom, which was a little odd, and if I went again I'd probably spend the extra and get the ensuite. I found it a little frustrating sometimes when the room next door decided to shower at 5 am - it was a noisy shower and inevitably woke us up. The cafe downstairs had nice coffee and muffins etc, which was a nice and cheap way to start the morning. I walk a lot so found most places easily accessible on foot, although less energetic folk may prefer to use the buses/taxis were are both very reasonably priced and efficient. The front desk staff were wonderful and couldn't have been more helpful - especially when the padlock on our case broke and they helped us to remove it!

Reviews.Title: “Was SO clean, and cute front desk clerk from Nova Scottia.”
Reviews.Author: Alicat009
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is faubulous! I was considering moving there, but didn't. The relationship I had there ended. I was actually there in the early 90's I think it was. Anyway, if you don't like rain--it was the rainy season when I was there. Don't remember when exactly that was, but probably can find out for anyone interested. Vancouver IS the rainforest. So it rains quite a lot. The city is right on the Pacific with a mountain range lining just above the ocean. Breathtaking scenery cause you have the mountains and the ocean, obviously. (I will never be a travel writer!) The people are so friendly and helpful. Canada is bigger than the US as a land mass; and there is a much more sparse population. So plenty of land for everyone. It doesn't feel as crowded as the US would seem. And everyone says, "ay?" at the end of their sentances. So cute. So, GO, GO, GO to Vancouver! Also a ton of Sushi restaurants because it is close to Asia. Was the place to go for sushi in the 90's. Now Boston seems to rival my memory of how very many sushi spots there were there.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Vancouver - best location for the best price”
Reviews.Author: faganj
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after dropping off rental car, so we were delighted at how easy it was to get around from the YWCA to see so much of central Vancouver - Downtown, Yaletown, Gastown, Chinatown, Granville Island, Stanley Park, etc. Room was compact, but clean and well serviced. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Only quibble with room was that we'd opted for a shared bathroom (between us and next room). Next time I'd go for a bathroom down the hall - more to choose from if someone's in one, and less noisy when your neighbours are having an early shower, etc.! Alternatively, you can pay more and get an ensuite, but I think I'd be happy with the shared one down the hall just as much, and a lot less cost.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value”
Reviews.Author: NBCooma
Reviews.Content: Clean, very comfortable bed, close to SkyTrain , quiet. Good friendly service from Reception. The shared toilet/shower takes a little while to get used to, but fortunately there is a sink inside your own room.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: soulscape
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel several times and I can never recommend it enough. The rooms are always clean and comfortable, and the staff always polite and helpful even when me and friends have came back drunk in the middle of the night. Reserve parking at time of reservation as it is limited but very secure. There is kitchens on most floors if u need to prepare or rehaeat food, plus theres fridges in each room so u can store food over a couple days or keep that amazing food u ate downtown. The only slightly bad thing I could ever say is that they have some shared bathroom and hall bathroom system in some of the CHEAPER rooms which is kinda weird and I personally enjoy that much but for like $75-85, its nothing to really complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: desmondo84
Reviews.Content: After reading many good reviews we were slightly disappointed by our stay. Our double room was not particuarly cheap: 125/night. In addition, the room was quite cramped and the shower was dreadful. On the plus side, the hotel is spotless and our room had a fridge and TV. When we returned to vancouver we stayed at the sandman around the corner for a few dollars more but was well worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value. Clean Rooms. Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: rufferta
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a total of five nights and felt the hotel was a very nice value for the price. We had a room with a private bath and it was very clean. The front desk staff was especially nice and made us feel welcome. It was not a luxury hotel, but I would recommend it to anyone who wanted both economy and safety.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: srivdevan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in YWCA for a week. It was very comfortable and the staff are very friendly. The location is also accessible to many important places like Robson street, China Town and also very near to the Sky train station

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: dombound09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the YWCA for three nights and it was perfect. Perfect price and location! Walking distance to everything that you could possibly need or want to see. China town, Robson Street, the Trolly system, Aquabus system, Skytrain system and many fabulous restaurants. Very clean and quiet no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Clarky86
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights while I accusomed myself with the city before heading off inland on the greyhound bus. I really don't have anything bad to say about this place. Great location, clean, good service and just a general good vibe about the place. If you're looking for somewhere quiet that is close to downtown, YWCA is your best choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: paulgl2
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay just one night before heading off to whistler,and would stay again on our way back through Vancouver if we liked it, but we were so impressed with our 1 night stay that we booked for 2 nights on the way back. We had the 2 double room, so it had plenty of space,we also used the kitchen facilities which were pretty good. It was a very good start for our 2 weeks in Canada, and would certainly stay there again if we visited Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “cleaner and better than many of the hotels in the UK !”
Reviews.Author: seedsnbeads
Reviews.Content: As a single (40ish) female traveller I can't recommend place enough. Really good location and spotlessly clean. i stayed in a single for 2 nights then a twin for 1 with shared bathroom. Although the place was clearly busy, i never once saw anyone when I used the B/room so no probs about wandering in your pj.s !!.. Some may call the room 'basic' but I think that maybe gives a bad impression. I had a single room and a single bed, a lovely , well thought out sink and vanity unit, a fridge, a tv, a desk,a telephone, plently of storage and a file of information about the city.., more like a halls of residence i guess.. without the parties.. Staff were lovely and very helpful and a little coffee shop in the foyer for breakfast.. Walking North into downtown Van' is straighforward and quick. I headed South over the bridge in search of a bead shop and walked for hours... Ended up in Granville Island where i spent a lovely day , then got the water taxi back and a short, lovely walk along the river to the Y.. When i next go to Vancouver, i wouldn't even consider anywhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: carrowsmith
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic place to stay, modern, secure and hd no problems during my two stays. Well recommended!

Reviews.Title: “nice place in a fantastic town!”
Reviews.Author: pull
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week in a double room with private bathroom. We had a fridge and cable tv. A cool thing was the kitchen in which you could make your own meal. We saved a lot of money. The location is great and near to downtown and the staff was really nice and helpful We absolutely loved this hotel and would definitely stay here again if we go back to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Aradia76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently when going to a concert. The hotel is directly across from BC Place, so it was a great location to stay. I was pleasantly surprised by how much I liked it! The rooms were clean, and the staff were very friendly and helpful. I would recommend it to anyone staying in Vancouver who isn't concerned with frills, and just wants a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Y stay anywhere else ...”
Reviews.Author: Sydneygirlz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Y for four nights late in September .The room was clean and comfortable . The staff were friendly, helpful and had lots of local knowledge . And it is great value . It cost us for four nights what we spent for one night at another downtown hotel earlier in the month. It made us realise we don't need to spend the big bucks to have a great experience. Infact we enjoyed the Y because it is more real and connected to the life of the city than a regular tourist hotel. Had some problems with the wireless provider but after help from reception the owner of the company ended up calling me directly to sort it out. So can't ask for better problem solving than that! All in all a really great place to stay and good value too,

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Quality at Hostel Costs!”
Reviews.Author: redbluegreen
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a week, and I really have nothing negative to say about this hotel! We chose the YWCA because the room value is SO much better than any other hotel in the city. At first, this made us a little nervous, but after arriving at the hotel all our worries disappeared. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. They were quick to offer suggestions for good places to eat in the area right when we checked in, and gave us a map, highlighting the way to get to many of the attractions in the area we were interested in seeing! Our room had two double beds and since no private bathroom was available, we shared a bathroom with the neighboring room. This was never a problem, and I never felt like I was going to get walked in on. The locking system for the shared bathrooms is very secure. The room itself is very basic. There is a desk, a small tv, a closet, a sink, and some shelving. The pictures on the website are very accurate. Each room also has a mini-fridge and its own sink and mirrors, so you don't need to spend time in the shared bathroom getting ready. The rooms are kept clean, just as clean as any other more expensive hotel I have stayed in, and we had a lovely view of science world from the 9th floor. There is also a little coffee shop connected to the hotel where you can buy beverages and baked goods on your way out in the morning. The hotel has a 'quiet time' (for rooms with shared bathrooms at least) of 11pm, so we were never disturbed during the night by noise. As well, the front doors are locked at 11pm, so you have to buzz in to get inside. There are also keys for the elevator and you turn your room keys in to the front desk every time you leave the hotel, so I felt very safe staying there. By far my favorite thing about this hotel was the location! It is within walking distance to almost anything you could need. Chinatown, Gastown, Yaletown, and Granville Street are just a quick walk away. If you want to go to Granville Market it is a short walk to the seabus terminal, which takes you directly there and the ride is beautiful. It is also two blocks away from the chinatown skytrain station which will get you where you need to go in no time. When we booked the hotel we had no idea how close to everything we would be, so it was a pleasant surprise to see how much money we saved on transportation! Overall, I was EXTREMELY impressed with the YWCA hotel! If you are a budget traveller in Vancouver, especially if you will not be driving in the city, this hotel is perfect. I will definitely be back next time I visit Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hels_belsMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This place is much better value than anywhere else I found in Vancouver. It is basic, but good and clean. We stayed in 3 different rooms - no problems in the private and the semi-private bathrooms. The 'hall bathroom' had a plastic wrapped very noisy bed. The location was decent, walking distance to everything relevant. Not too dodgy area (there are very scary areas in Vancouver). Staff were helpful. Kitchen and laundry facilities were fine. Good views from the rooms up high (third floor room had views of some druggies in the alley though). I stayed here on 3 separate occasions so obviously would happily stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: lautin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here based on the reviews. It was easy to find, we caught the bus from the airport to Vancouver and walked to the YWCA. Were accosted for money en-route, but generally felt quite safe. Check-in was easy and security was good. The room was quite small and the bed uncomfortable, but it was clean and communal facilities looked good. There was a secure luggage store which we used after we checked out so we could explore the city without our luggage. There was also internet facilities which was useful.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific value”
Reviews.Author: MuyMalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while dropping our son off for his 1st year at UBC. Because we brought a van-load of his stuff, having low cost parking in a downtown hotel with in/out privileges was a real bonus. We had a lot of errands to run to get him settled, but we also wanted to do the touristy things in town as part of our vacation so the Y met our needs on both counts. The shared bathroom worked out better than I thought, with a locking arrangement that assures privacy. Having a sink in the room helps too. The room and the hotel was clean and comfortable. An espresso bar off the lobby was handy for getting a quick start on the day. There's a discount if you're a member of your local Y.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: D8andS7
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at 10.00am after an overnight flight. And much to our shock we were able to go into our room, which was totally brilliant. The rooms were very nice, quite big and clean. There are communal kitchens and a laundry. The staff were helpful and were able to give advice. Security at the hotel was good, the doors locked at 11.00pm but you could get buzzed in. The lifts also had a security key which was also good. It was in quite a good location, you could walk to most destinations in the city. A very good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Rugby tours!”
Reviews.Author: BCRoadhog
Reviews.Content: I have read the other reviews of this hotel and many are accurate, however there is one thing to look out for. Because of it's modest cost, the YWCA attracts many tours especially school sports clubs (rugby, football, hockey etc). If you happen to be on a floor with 20 young people, many of whom are going away from home for the first time, then expect some high jinks till the early hours of the morning. If, like me, you like to get early to bed, and then early to rise you will find yourself short of sleep after a couple of days. Be sure to pack the ear-plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel / Good Price”
Reviews.Author: Zamonya
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the YWCA 5 nights in mid-July. After travelling through the rockies and staying in a few Hostels this Hotel was a real gem. We had a private room with private bathroom an television. It was small but cosy, but really enough place for the both of us and our 4 luggages :). The kitchen an the floor was a bonus too, and the stuff was very helpfull. I would it recommend to everyone who wants to stay on a budget but have the benefits of an hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing negative to say. You get whatyou pay for and more.”
Reviews.Author: MandMfromMelb
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here twice as we commuted through Vancouver. We stayed in a room with a private bathroom both times. I'm sure you've stayed at places that demand a high price tag, but are completely impractical for the traveller. You may be surrounded by great views or furnishings but all these nice extras are superfluous to your needs and things you do really need when you're on an extended holiday.... ironing board....convenient washing facilities.....the sort of comfortable furnishings you'd find at home... are either troublesome to acquire or simply not available. This is not one of those places. In fact, this place hits the spot when it comes to providing what you need when travelling. This place gets the basics right where so many businesses get these basic things so wrong. In short, this place is awesome and is in the top 3 hotels we stayed in throughout our trip to Canada (out of say 20 hotels we stayed in). It was also one of the 3 cheapest. Make no mistake it is budget, but it has all the necessary conveniences and the basic luxuries (space and facilities). Great washing facilities and the disabled room we had was huge. We looked forward to returning to this accommodation despite having stayed extensive periods in hotels where we paid rates over 7 times more expensive. This hotel is close to the 'bad' part of town, but you wouldn't know it unless you happened to walk in a North-East direction. You are close to a skytrain station (to get you across town a little quicker) and you're close to the Vancouver retail district. The people at reception were very helpful and friendly. The money we saved we put towards dinner at Le Gavroche. Lovely ambience, but the quality of the meal did not match the price. Rooms only contain double or single beds as far as I am aware. This was my only slight criticism. YWCA. Highly Highly recommended if you're looking for comfort without pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: geriatrix
Reviews.Content: Excellent value choice for Vancouver. We stayed here just before going back to the UK. It's a convenient location, and the staff are helpful and friendly. The room was attractive and well equipped. Unfortunately all the rooms with private bathrooms were taken so we had booked one with a bathroom shared between two rooms. This was OK, but would have preferred a private bath, Still at least our room had a sink and mirror. There was also a fridge, but no microwave. There was a kitchenette just down the corridor which had a kettle, toaster and microwave, and a fully equipped kitchen on the floor below. We liked staying here, it was clean, safe, and friendly. Just one extra point. It said in the room guide that the Airporter bus to the airport stops at the hotel next door. It doesn't, any longer, having changed its routing. That said, if there's more than one person, and the traffic is light, a taxi is probably better value anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: PGBritishColumbia
Reviews.Content: Great place for a single traveller to stay at. Felt very secure and the location was great! Room was comfortable and very quiet. It was worth the extra money to book a room with a private bath.

Reviews.Title: “The Basics on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: LolaBee
Reviews.Content: Staying in Vancouver is expensive, but the YMCA is not. It provides just the basics, but the location is good and access to the skytrain is just around the corner. No great views, or fancy extras but the room was clean and the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: tropicsboy
Reviews.Content: stayed here for about 3 days, neat budget place, very functional was a bit apprehensive about the shared bathroom but the system works very well. clean room close to downtown amenities. but not for those looking for something fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Plain Decor, Cheap Rates, Clean Facilities”
Reviews.Author: kayeen
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in a single room with no TV and the shower/toilet facilities down the hallway for $56.00 per night + tax. The "single" room is the epitome of basic hotel accommodation. The room I stayed in is exactly the same (if not the same one) as in the example photo for a "single room" on the hotel website (the photo with the Asian woman at the desk). The only issue I had with the room was that there was not sufficient lighting for reclining on the bed to read. I remedied this by using my suitcase as a makeshift nightstand and placed the desk lamp on it for reading on the bed (no TV remember). The shower/toilet facilities where always kept immaculately clean and they were always available for use. In fact, I never saw another hotel guest on the floor when I was walking to and from my room to the washing facilities. I did hear hallway noise from the kitchen facility and fellow guests coming and going during the daytime and early evening, but nothing (not a peep) in the late evenings. Nice restful sleeps. The efficiency and personality level of the front desk staff was on par with the basic/no-frills accommodation of the hotel... no person was rude and no person was great at providing service.
