They are just there and give you $56 per night service. The hotel does have a small room that guests can hold luggage in, but it there is no bellboy service so the room is not maintained by the hotel. Guests place their own luggage in the room and retrieve it themselves... meaning store your luggage here at your own risk. I stored my luggage with no problem. There is a small coffee/snack shop in the lobby that is good for a morning cup, pastry or piece of fruit. Also, there are a number of places to eat or have a drink nearby and walking to Yaletown and the area on Robson that has all the food & beverage options anyone needs is reasonable distance from the hotel... the area on Robson past Burrard is not as close as Yaletown, but is near enough for a pleasant walk. All-in-all, the only other time I have experienced accommodations that are this clean and efficient has been in Southeast Asia. It met all my basic needs for a clean room, comfortable bed, restful sleep and proximity to key parts of the city. Now if only Vancouver could do something about all that dismal rain and dark gray days! Also, I did find the food quality in the Vancouver to be mediocre for the high prices and felt that they do not treat single diners very well unless you sit at the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced and located close to all the action”
Reviews.Author: globalsojourn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister for a girls getaway to vancouver. I was apprehensive about sharing a bathroom with another room. This is the only downside of this hotel. I couldn't get over hearing other people doing their business while I was in my room. Otherwise, it is a clean, well maintained hotel and the front desk people are warm and willing to help in any way they can. Overall, for the price its a great place to stay for people on a low budget.

Reviews.Title: “So cosy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: uratargetmarket
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this hotel and can't recommend it enough. I went during December and they had decorated up the place so tastefully and nicely, such a cute xmassy style. The staff are endlessly helpful, it's pretty cheap compared to hotels of the same standard, and the rooms are large with really clean and good standard bathrooms. It's a really quiet hotel and perfect location for exploring Vancouver. The rooms are really warm if it's cold when you're there and you get a TV with a ridiculous number of channels. Aaah Canadian TV...so rubbish and so addictive. Also for someone from Britain- the beds are HUGE! Would love to stay there again, especially near xmas time

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: epacheco14
Reviews.Content: We took the advise of Tripadvisor and once again were not disappointed. What a great place! The staff was really friendly and helpful and had great suggestions about what to do in the city. The room was really comfortable and even had cable tv and a great bed. The bathroom, although not in the room was kept very clean and we had no trouble showering when we wanted to. We also used the kitchen and saved some money eating breakfast there. Although you have to pay extra for parking our bill came to $85 a night including parking. For Vancouver we felt like that was a great price. We'd stay here again in a minute and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day weekend stay, recommended”
Reviews.Author: ms9
Reviews.Content: Booked a double bed private bath. Was on 12th floor. Very clean, just the right size for 2. Nothing fancy but clean. Maid service daily. Quiet. You leave your room key with the front desk and retrieve it when you come back. Doors locked nightly at 11 but you can be rung in. Hotel staff very pleasant and welcoming. Internet available for $. Transit map in lobby for reference. There is no train from the airport, bus only but easy to use. There are several kitchens and laundry but we did not use. Vancouver is a very young population. City is clean and safe. Be careful in east downtown - walking between Gastown and Chinatown-area is concentrated in shabby characters. Not related to the hotel, but my one comment about being about the city is that the panhandlers/beggars are very aggressive. My encounters left me very angry with how rude they are. Not a reflection of the city but just a warning - ignore anyone wanting to ask you a question.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: remstar
Reviews.Content: Despite having to dodge workers digging up slabs of concrete at the front door, everything else about the YWCA met my expectations according to the good reviews here & from other sites. It's clean & friendly, with comfy beds & pillows. In a great location, just around the corner from Robson st and a 5min walk along Robson to the main shopping strip, along with Granville st. The kitchens were clean, one of the desk guys gave us a few plates and cups without charge. One of us even left our bag/purse in one of the kitchens and a very honest fellow guest promptly handed it to the front desk. What a relief! It was a bit of a hike, but we walked to Stanley Park and the totem poles from the hotel. An easy stroll and a bit of shopping along the way made it a pleasant walk. A slight incline on the way back was a little difficult for our tired feet, but they were soothed after stopping into the Robson st market. Not much of a market, but the bare & very basic food court was a goldmine! A few asian style stalls sold cultural & some modern foods. We ate at the Japanese stall and had the best meal I'd had in a long time. All the ingredients were prepared/chopped up by an elderly man & woman in the background, which was then cooked from scratch. Delicious. Being opposite BC place, I'm guessing things would be hopping when events are held there. None while we were there, but a couple of nice restaurants/bars close by made it up for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good value in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: M_Gandhi
Reviews.Content: This place really is a great value for the money. We stayed in a double/double room with private bath, in a room on an upper floor. We checked in early, but had no problem getting into a room immediately. Like a previous reviewer, we too had a "glitch" with the bathroom lock (the other room had access to our bathroom when it shouldn't). Fortunately, one of the desk clerks was able to fix it fairly promptly. The location of the YWCA is on the eastern end of downtown, so getting places does require some walking. Nothing horrible, however, and Vancouver is a very interesting and beautiful city for walking. In addition, the jump on-jump off tour buses stop at the hotel next door, and tickets for those are good for two days, which mitigated the $35 (CAN) expense. The hotel room was very clean, and we didn't hear much noise from our neighbors. My two complaints were: a very firm bed (I'm used to a softer mattress, so for me this bed was like sleeping on a plank) and really thin, lumpy pillows that needed to be replaced. Otherwise, no complaints and I recommend the YWCA for anyone (families, solo travelers, backpackers) who is looking for a good, no-frills base from which to see a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: IrishRuth
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel with clean rooms and kitchen areas. Our room was quiet and the private bathroom was ideal. Great little coffee shop and lounge area. The location of this hotel is fantastic in an easy to navigate city.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Negar
Reviews.Content: My family and I (my parents, my siblings and I) spent a week in Vancouver YWCA Hotel in early June, 2007. We had an absolutely great stay. To give you a quick summary, I mention the following points as the major advantages of staying in this hotel: - Very clean hotel - Very prompt room service - Highly secure - Cooking facilities (a major money saver in a city like Vancouver) - Really friendly staff - Located in an extremely good location for visitors - Affordable price We are more than happy that we decided to stay in this hotel and we recommend it to any family (with kids of any age) to try it out.

HotelInfo.Name: YWCA Hotel Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 733 Beatty Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 2M4, Canada
